channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Founders Museum' from White House and PragerU blurs history, AI-generated fiction
item.description: Historians say it's good to highlight America's founders, but the project takes too narrow a view of history.

item.title: So um, why do we say 'um' so much?
item.description: Who knew two letters could spark so much conversation? This week, we're breaking down the many uses of "um" and why the word is so controversial.

item.title: Hitler's bunker is now just a parking lot. But it's a 'dark tourism' attraction anyway
item.description: Why evil histories sell. A visit to Hitler's bunker, and a deep dive into the economics and ethical quandaries of "dark tourism."

item.title: Trump cannot use Alien Enemies Act to deport Venezuelan gang members, appeals court rules
item.description: The administration deported people designated as Tren de Aragua members to a notorious prison in El Salvador where, it argued, U.S. courts could not o...

item.title: With federal money in doubt, California's high-speed train seeks a new path forward
item.description: The leaders of California's high-speed rail project say they've learned from past mistakes. But the troubled megaproject faces an uncertain future wit...

item.title: D.C. grand jurors reject latest wave of Justice Dept. indictment requests
item.description: One former federal prosecutor said of the indictment denials by D.C. grand juries that he's "never heard of this happening."

item.title: 9/2: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Trump says “we’re going in” when asked about possibly sending troops to Chicago; New book looks at the intelligence battle between Russia and the U.S.

item.title: Survivors of Maine mass shooting and victims’ relatives sue US government alleging negligence
Trump says 11 killed in US strike on drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela
item.description: The Trump administration has signalled a willingness to use military force against drug cartels.

item.title: What new weapons on show at huge parade say about China's military strength
item.description: Beijing has unveiled a range of military hardware in a show of might to Western powers.

item.title: Plane crashes in Wyoming mountains, killing girl and injuring family
item.description: A medical helicopter spotted the downed aircraft after its crew was asked to fly over the area in Bighorn National Forest.

item.title: 9/2: The Daily Report
item.description: Jericka Duncan reports on President Trump's plans to send troops to major U.S. cities, and why climate experts are criticizing the Energy Department.

item.title: Putin thanks Kim for North Koreans fighting in Ukraine
item.description: Thousands of North Korean soldiers are thought to have died while fighting for Russia during its war in Ukraine.

item.title: Hundreds of women with brooms join protests as Indonesia leader flies to China
item.description: Hundreds of women brandishing broomsticks marched to parliament during fierce nationwide rallies.

item.title: Floods kill 30 and submerge 1,400 villages in Indian state
item.description: More than 354,000 people have been affected by the worst floods since 1988, as rescue efforts continue.

item.title: Trump cannot use Alien Enemies Act to deport members of Venezuelan gang, appeals court rules
Robert E. Lee portrait back up in West Point's library
item.description: A painting of Gen. Robert E. Lee dressed in his Confederate uniform is back on display in the West Point's library, several years after the storied ac...

item.title: Trump says he’s set to order federal intervention in Chicago and Baltimore, despite local opposition
item.description: President Donald Trump says he will direct federal law enforcement intervention to combat crime in Chicago and Baltimore, despite staunch opposition f...
